content.question: A. Describe what information the demographic transition model provides about a country. B. Identify ONE country listed in the table that is in stage 2 of the demographic transition. Describe ONE reason why this country is considered to be in stage 2 of the demographic transition. C. Using the data in the table, describe the relationship between birth rate and infant mortality rate as the epidemiological transition occurs in a country. D. Explain what the total fertility rate and the infant mortality rate imply about the roles of women in the countries listed in the table.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Identify the different types of data presented in maps and in quantitative and geospatial data.
